abstractText: The Saptavāra ("Seven Days") usually incorporates seven dhāraṇīs, the Vasudhārā, Vajravidāraṇā, Gaṇapatihṛdaya, Uṣṇīṣavijayā, Parṇaśavarī or Prajñāpāramitā, Mārīcī, and Grahamātṛkā. This collection associates each dhāraṇī with a specific day of the week, a tradition going back to at least the sixteenth century in Nepal. This paper manuscript, dated 1801 CE, contains the Saptavāra starting with an additional Mahākāladhāraṇī and Mahākālasādhana section placed at the very beginning, and continuing with the Vasundhārānāmāṣṭottaraśataka in the place of the usual Vasudhārādhāraṇī.
